subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] New messages posted
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
Hi again Mike E.

I record alot of water sessions so by speaking during these sessions I often drown out or destroy whats being said. I am also careful not to record on full mic volume (I use half volume on the mic at all times) because the water noise will drown out the underlying voices even tho its 15+ feet away from the mic.

Franks right theres little need to speak but it does make it seem more "real" or proof positive to some people to get the direct reply to thier own voice. If you feel it interferes with your sessions when you speak there are ways around it. Try asking the question in your head or make a list using wordpad of your questions to save with the files if you dont want to forget what ya asked. Just do what you feel comfortable with.

Misty


--- On Sun, 9/21/08, Michael Edwards <f1cracker75@yahoo.com> wrote:

> From: Michael Edwards <f1cracker75@...>
> Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] New messages posted
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Sunday, September 21, 2008, 10:27 PM
> Hi Misty been a long time since we spoke.
>  
> I remember back early this year when I first met Frank, and
> he too made the same comment as you, that you need not say
> anything.
>  
> I on the other hand could not accept this concept, but now
> after many of my crime case recordings, and reviewing all my
> questions asked, the voices told me what I needed to hear to
> get the right leads. As soon as I turn that radio on ,they
> start talking about what happened, and even when i am asking
> them a question they are still talking. I have had to learn
> how to block out my questioning to hear what they said when
> I was talking. 
>  
>  I did try a recording without asking a question once, but
> just could not do it again as I have this in my head you
> need to ask questions.
>  
> Its hard to let go of, but you are right, they know what
> you need to hear.
>  
> Mike
> 
> 
>  
> 
> --- On Sun, 9/21/08, Misty Dawn
> <bulletbabea@...> wrote:
> 
> From: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@yahoo.com>
> Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] New messages posted
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Sunday, September 21, 2008, 1:33 PM
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> They have made mentions of it over the years including a
> recent statement pertaining to the contact world which I
> just posted over on my esnips from last session. They said
> when the contact world first began it was very hard, and
> that access was terrible. Perhaps it is easier with some of
> the newer methods researchers are using to maintain contact.
> Franks box has opened up a new avenue for those who had a
> hard time hearing the traditional forms of evp. 
> 
> When I ask what the best method for contact is they always
> maintain its the method that no words are necessary. Or as
> one stated recently (also posted on esnips in water files)
> "I can telepathic, you just can't hear good
> telepathic" "it will always be tenuous". This
> coming after a few restless nights of being woken up to loud
> voices speaking to me or saying my name. Also a few things
> going on when I was wide awake and fully alert. 
> 
> I have also had some info come thru on "stations"
> and even one recording where voices I know seemed to jump
> from one group to another as I switched methods they could
> be heard introducing themselves to those surrounding them
> stating why they were barging in there to communicate. I
> find it all of interest tho it tends to be alot to wrap ones
> mind around.
> 
> Misty Dawn
>
